snippet: The New York courts, usually bustling with arraignments, have taken on an unusual tranquility after a steep decline in arrests.
abstract: Activity in New York City courts slows dramatically during third week of precipitous drop in arrests by New York Police Department; sharp downturn reflects ongoing conflict between officers and Mayor Bill de Blasio; some public defenders say they hope downturn will continue, arguing that decline in minor arrests has not resulted in rise in felonies.

byline.original: By JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr. and STEPHANIE CLIFFORD
byline.contributor: Al Baker and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The New York courts, usually bustling with arraignments, have taken on an unusual tranquility after a steep decline in arrests.

headline.main: As Police Go Idle, So Do New York City Courts
headline.print_headline: As Police Go Idle, So Do City Courts
